text: Today, I'm going to

teach you how to make a very cool and unique
travel necklace that will send a lot of oo's
and aah's your way.

First things first is your going to need the
necessary material.

Polymer clay which you can get at your local
art store.

I got mine at Michaels for 2-3 dollars a colour
and the following tools.

First you take a piece of blue polymer clay
like so.

The more you take, the bugger your world and
pendent will be.

Roll it into a ball using your hands or flat
surface.

Then take a rolling pin to flatten it out
but not top much because you're going to want
to leave some thickness.
I'll tell you why later.

Than take your earth green polymer clay and
roll it up on the the flat surface your using
as so.
It's time to make the continents.

I used a photo of the world to get the actual
accurate shapes of the continents.
Voila!

Place the your north and south america in
place and move on to the other continents.

I decided to display Africa , Europe and Antarctica
and some islands.
A big sorry to the left out continents.
I love you just the same!
You can do whatever continents you'd like.

After you've carved them out using your sharp
tool and put them in place, clean up the green

cutouts so that they look as neat as possible
on top of the blue.

Add some islands for that special touch and
then you are ready to move on to create the
flying airplane.

Grab some white polymer clay and rip off a
small pice above the size of your baby fingernail,

unless you are a baby, then that is way too
small, but wow you must have some artistic

talent starting arts and crafts at such a
young age.
Roll the clay into a small hot dog shape.
This is going to be the body of the airplane.

Place this on the left side of your earth
like I did.

Take another piece of white clay and roll
it out on your flat surface.
It's time to make some wings.

Take your sharp tool and cut the wings like
so.

Make sure they aren't too big or your plane
will look funny.

You're going to want to make two wings to
avoid any flying complications.

Now your going to want to take two very small
pieces of polymer clay just like so to make

your horizontal stabilizers I believe they
are called.

These babies go on the back bottom of your
plane.

Next you will want to take another small piece
of clay to make the vertical fin; which is

the shark like fin that goes on the back of
the plane.
I put mine too close to the front.
It's all coming together!

Next you want to create the vapour trail that
behind the plane that shows its in motion.

Take a small piece of white clay and roll
it into a very thin rope.

Cut the rope so that it is about have the
width of your earth.

Place it on your earth behind the plane do
that it looks like the place is turning flying
around the world.

Don't put the line straight, have it curved
a bit like I did here.

Now we are going to take a medium size eye
pin which you can also get at Michaels or

any crafts store that sells jewellery making
stuff.

Place it at the top of your earth and push
it all the way through until only the loop
at the top is sticking out.

This is why we kept the earth rather thick
so you can;t see the eye pin.

Oh and I almost forgot, we need to make the
engine intakes that go just below the wings
closer to the body.

You want to take a ball point size piece of
clay for this and put on on either side like
so.
Yay!
Good work.
It's looking do great.

Now it's time to bake your necklace...yes
that's right!
This will turn the clay into a hard material.

Set your oven to whatever the package of the
polymer clay tells you too.
It should be about 275 F.

Place your pendant on a cookie sheet and place
in the over for 15 minutes.
After 15 minutes, take it out and let it cool.
Now it's time to paint on some details.

You'll need black acrylic paint and a thin
paint brush.
Now start painting on the airplane windows.

Take your time since you are painting on very
small details and you don't want the windows
too large.

you can also put some detail on the wings
like I did.
Add on your chain to the eye pin and ta dah!

You have a fabulous travel necklace that will
make your friends jealous.

What kind of travel art do you want to see
me create next?
Share your ideas below!
Happy Travels!!!
